message.content:
cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with problems related to on-line algorithms, stochastic games, and optimization, which are all topics that fall under the umbrella of computer science. The use of algorithms to select values and maximize gains suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) category. The analysis of the algorithms and the consideration of optimal off-line strategies suggest that the paper may also belong to the cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) category. The use of randomness and probability in the problem formulation suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) category. The focus on maximizing gains and optimizing performance suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. Finally, the use of algorithms to make decisions and the consideration of optimal strategies suggest that the paper may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) category.
